feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Key Management Service
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Key Management Service

entry.content:
Cloud KMS now supports key encapsulation mechanisms (KEMs) for sharing secrets in Preview. KEMs are designed to be resistant to post-quantum attacks. You can use the following KEM algorithms:

  • ML_KEM_768
  • ML_KEM_1024
  • KEM_XWING

For more information about key encapsulation mechanisms, see Key encapsulation mechanisms. To learn how to use key encapsulation mechanisms to share secrets, see Encapsulate and decapsulate using KEMs.
entry.summary: Cloud KMS now supports key encapsulation mechanisms (KEMs) in Preview, offering enhanced security against post-quantum attacks with algorithms like ML-KEM-768, ML-KEM-1024, and KEM-XWING. This feature allows for more secure secret sharing.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud KMS introduces post-quantum KEMs for secure secret sharing

entry.content: Cloud HSM for Google Workspace now lets you use Cloud HSM keys for client-side encryption (CSE) to protect sensitive workloads in Google Workspace. For more information about Cloud HSM for Google Workspace, including how to get started, see Onboard to Cloud HSM for Google Workspace.
entry.summary: You can now use Cloud HSM keys to protect sensitive data in Google Workspace with client-side encryption.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud HSM for Google Workspace
